# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame; colname="dt", outcolname="ym")
    df[!, outcolname] = @. string(Dates.Year(DateTime(df[$colname]))) * string(Dates.Month(DateTime(df[$colname])))
end
```

Usage:
```julia
# Assuming df is your DataFrame with dt column
add_yearmonth(df) # If you want to overwrite the existing function
# Or
new_df = add_yearmonth(df, outcolname="new_ym") # To keep the original df unchanged and return a new one
```
